page.title: 05WOMERSLEY CHURCH.
page.content: The church was built in the Twelfth century by the Normans. There is a statue of a Norman crusader who helped to build the church, his name was Sir Robert Newmarch. On the south wall is a memorial of his father. The religion of the church is the Church of England. There are services held on Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, and Sundays. The services last for about one hour. Thirty to forty people attend the services, they are all from the local area so they don't have far to travel.There are special services at Christmas, Easter, and at Harvest time. St.Martyns, is the only church in the village,and although it is only small,will be of interest to visitors to the village.
